page.title: 12WESTHAVEN FARM, part 2
page.content: The{sea winds}can affect the crops both adversely and beneficially. If the wind is especially strong it can be detrimental to the crops, but on the other hand the salt-laden air from the sea can{prevent the mildew}to which{barley}is prone, from becoming too severe. The{grain crops}from the farm go to a grain merchant to be sold, the{seed {potatoes}are sold to contract and the {potatoes}and{vegetables}for consumption go to the local{pre-packed {vegetable company}to be sent all over Britain. There are{19 bullocks}and{one heifer on the farm and there is some{rough {pasture}for them in the summer. Diet in the summer is{turnips}and{straw } and in the winter is{hay}and{bruised {oats. {
